III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section
Description
1

(1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On or around 7/2/25, a youth became frustrated and struck a staff
member. The staff member struck the youth in the stomach with a
back hand. The youth had a small red mark on their stomach as a
result. The staff member was placed on administrative leave.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was contacted via email on July 29, 2025 and
reported they had no additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July
16, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A said
he does not have any staff he likes at the facility and does not like
Staff 1 in particular. Youth A said Staff 1 is “mean” to him however
denied anything physical occurring between him and Staff 1.
Youth A said Staff 1 will cuss at the youth saying things like “you
can’t fucking do that” and “you need to fucking stop it”. Youth A
said he has never been hurt by Staff 1 or any other staff while
being placed at Mott Children’s Residence. Youth A said he was
recently at the hospital for “hip surgery” and denied any other
visits to the hospital.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July
16, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B said
he is on the same unit at Youth A and they get along “good”.
Youth B said Youth A was by the Johnson Cottage door banging
on it and trying to push it open. Youth B said Staff 1 shut the door
and told Youth A he was not allowed in that cottage as it was not
his cottage. Youth B said Youth A got upset and started to hit Staff
1. Youth B said Staff 1 pushed Youth A away with one hand
“gently” on his chest. Youth B said Youth A started yelling “he hit
me” and then walked away with Therapist. Youth B said he has
never seen Staff 1 hit any Youth A, stating in that situation “he
was just moving [Youth A] away from him because he was hitting
him”. Youth B said Staff 1 is a “very nice staff” and he has not had
any concerns about him.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July
16, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C said
he has many staff he likes and gets along with at the facility, only
2

identifying one staff that is “grumpy all the time” and so does not
like when she works. Youth C said he has never seen any youth
get hurt by staff and denied ever being hurt himself. Youth C said
he is in the same unit as Youth A and denied ever seeing Staff 1
or any other staff hit him or hurt him in any other manner. Youth C
said Staff 1 is a “nice staff” and denied him ever doing anything
that is against the rules. Youth C said he has never had any
issues or concerns with Staff 1 or any other staff at the facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July 16,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 said he
works on Youth A’s unit, however, has been placed on
administrative leave since July 3, 2025. Staff 1 said he was placed
on leave due to an incident with Youth A. Staff 1 said he was
sitting outside of Johnson Cottage door with Youth A, Youth B,
Youth C, Staff 2, Therapist, and another youth from a different
program. Staff 1 said Youth A was antagonizing Youth B, so he
asked Youth A to step away which made Youth A upset. Staff 1
said Youth A began to cuss and yell at him and then tried to go
into Johnson Cottage door. Staff 1 said he told Youth A he was
not allowed in that cottage as it was not his current cottage. Staff 1
said this made Youth A even more upset and he began to “swing
on him”, stating Youth A hit him in the forehead with a closed fist
one time. Staff 1 said he was deflecting Youth A’s punches and
moved his arm up to block a punch and Youth A screamed “he hit
me” however Staff 1 stated he does not believe he made any
contact with Youth A. Staff 1 said the incident happened very
quickly and once Youth A made that statement, Youth A left with
Therapist. Staff 1 said if he did make contact, it was not
intentional, and he was not trying to hurt Youth A. Staff 1 said he
is trained in Therapeutic Crisis Intervention (TCI) which taught him
the approved way to deflect a youth’s punches, explaining to put
hands up and keep a distance if able. Staff 1 denied being trained
to hit a youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July 16,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 said he has
worked “a few times” with Staff 1, stating they are on different
cottages so do not consistently work together. Staff 2 said he was
present on July 2, 2025, during the incident with Staff 1 and Youth
A. Staff 2 said he did not see Staff 1 hit Youth A as his back was
to them however did hear Youth A say, “he hit me”. Staff 2 said
Youth A then left with Therapist and he did not have any other
contact with Youth A or Staff 1. Staff 2 said he was trained in TCI,
stating that if a youth begins to hit staff, they are to utilize a small
child restraint if there is enough staff, to open hand block or
3

deflect punches, or to move away from the situation. Staff 2
denied being trained to hit youth back. Staff 2 said he has never
had any concerns with Staff 1’s behaviors at work.
Therapist was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July
16, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Therapist said
she was present on July 2, 2025, during the incident with Staff 1
and Youth A. Therapist said she was talking with Staff 2 when she
heard the cottage door open then shut, a slap and then another
slap, then Youth A state “he hit me”. Therapist said she did not
see Staff 1 hit Youth A. Therapist said she took Youth A inside
immediately and Youth A said “[Staff 1] hit me”. Therapist said she
did not see any marks, bruises, or bleeding. Therapist said she
brought Youth A to Program Officer and left. Therapist said she is
trained in TCI and if a youth starts to become aggressive the staff
should walk away if able, open hand deflect punches or go into a
restraint. Therapist denied being trained to hit youth back.
Therapist said she has never seen Staff 1 become frustrated or
upset and he is generally a calm and good staff.
Program Officer was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
July 16, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Program
Officer said she supervises the nursing staff and when Youth A
was brought into the office on July 2, 2025, the nurse had left for
the day and so she assisted the medical assistant in talking with
and taking photos of Youth A. Program Officer said Youth A stated
he was hit by Staff 1 in the stomach. Program Officer said she
took a picture of the area, stating she did not see any marks
present. Program Officer said Youth A told her it hurt however
then went outside and was running around playing. Program
Officer said all staff are trained in TCI which would teach them to
use an open hand to deflect youth’s punches or have another staff
assist in placing a youth in a restraint. Program Officer denied
staff being trained to hit youth.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of July 2, 2025, outside doorway to Johnson
Cottage was reviewed on July 7, 2025. The video is five
seconds long, Staff 1 is sitting in a chair facing Youth A, Youth A
is standing by the door, Youth B is leaning against the building,
Youth C is standing across from Youth A, Staff 2 is sitting in a
chair with his back to Youth A, and Therapist is standing in front to
Staff 2 bent over looking at something in her hands. Youth A
opens the door and Staff 1 shuts it with his right hand. Youth A
swings his right arm backward hitting Staff 1 in the face, Staff 1
4

responds by swinging his right hand backwards against Youth A’s
stomach. Youth A then walks out of the camera view.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 had disciplinary action for
time and attendance on December 13, 2024, January 10,
2025, and March 10, 2025. In addition, Staff 1 had
disciplinary action for supervision on January 6, 2021, and
failure to maintain professionalism on March 10, 2025. Staff
1 completed his annual TCI training on March 13, 2025,
and March 20, 2025.
• Incident Report dated July 2, 2025, written by Staff 1. The
incident report is consistent with Staff 1’s interview.
• Incident Report dated July 2, 2025, written by Staff 2. The
incident report was consistent with Staff 2’s interview.
• Incident Report dated July 2, 2025, written by Therapist.
The incident report was consistent with Therapist’s
interview.
• Medical statement from Hurley Medical Center dated July
3, 2025, reporting that Youth A was seen and treated at
Hurley Medical Center Emergency Department on July 3,
2025. There were no details noted on the note.
• Youth A’s After Visit Summary from Hurley Medical Center
dated July 3, 2025, was reviewed. The summary reported
Youth A was seen for a “well child” visit. There were no
concerns regarding Youth A noted during the visit.
• Nursing Notes for Youth A dated July 2, 2025, were
reviewed. The nursing note indicated Youth A was seen
due to reporting he was slapped in the stomach by Staff 1.
The note states “no marks were observed at that time. A
picture was taken at 4:33pm.” The photo was reviewed and
did not show any marks or bruises.
• Whaley Children’s Center Physical Intervention Policy was
reviewed. The policy states staff are trained in and required
to use Therapeutic Crisis Intervention (TCI) model for de-
escalation and physical intervention. The policy outlines
prohibited interventions which includes “Hitting or striking,
throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth on any part of
their body.”
• The Therapeutic Crisis Intervention (TCI) Manual was
reviewed. The directive for “deflecting a swing” is “raise
their arm towards the ceiling and deflect the swing away
using their forearm with their hand open”.
5

Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per video reviewed,
Staff 1 did not utilize an approved TCI technique when he hit
Youth A in the stomach with the back of his hand.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
